event.title: water put in
event.description:
First I labeled each one of my Freezer Bags which has a permanent marker. I wrote on the bag todays date, the meal name and the instructions for the day I can make it. (some with the meals will need meat broth added, water put in, sour cream added or anything else..so I made note to the actual bag what I necessary to do so I remember! ) I also notated on my bags if the dish was supposed to be served over rice or maybe egg noodles etc..

Teriyaki Bird (2 Bags)
Savory Veg Beef Soup (2 Bags)
Balanced BBQ Chicken (2 Bags)
Stephanie’s Goulash/Beef Stew (2 Bags)
—I made the Balsamic & Onion Grass Roast immediately so I won’t include this from the instructions, I will post the recipe at the bottom. =)

Next…I began CHOPPING VEGETABLES! (It’s less bad as it appears! )
As I chopped I placed the correct amount in each case. (I started with Each of the onions, then did peppers, then potatoes…(see below intended for instructions).
I lined up every one of my freezer bags surrounding the counter and just dumped the needed amount of veggies for each recipe in the individual bags (see below). I never measure anything so I simply guesstimate!

After I had the veggies chopped in addition to distributed I tackled the meat…for this round connected with freezer cooking I only was mandated to cook the ground beef for the vegetable soup…the hen & beef stew meat stay raw.

For the actual ground beef..take (1) cut onion and (2) cut garlic cloves and brown them together. If you experience super savy you can let the beef brown while you’re chopping the veggies! Make cool, instructions below on easy methods to finish.

For the fowl, I washed & clipped it and left (4) with the breasts whole (for the teriyaki chicken) plus the other (4) I cut in half although I felt like that (for the healthy barbeque chicken).

I trimmed the meat stew meat of any fat and also cut it down in smaller cubes.

After placing the meat from the correct bags I included the spices and other ingredients.

Here is just how it broke down per bag..

Teriyaki Chicken (2 Bags)
Split a huge bag of Baby Celery between the 2 bags
Cut Red Onion directly into Large Chunks and break between the 2 carriers
(1) 20oz can pineapple around each bag (undrained)
(2) Garlic Cloves cut per bag
(2) Chook Breasts in each travelling bag
1/2 cup teriyaki sauce in each bag
*Add 1/4 goblet teriyaki sauce to mix. Cook on HIGH regarding 4 hours or SMALL for 8 hours. Provide over Rice.
If you have been wondering which involving my healthy, clean eating, gluten-free recipes are great make ahead freezer-friendly dinner recipes, this is the post in your case! Freezing meals is this type of time saver and a great way to reduce food waste, BUT it usually is really hard to convey to which meals are freezer-friendly if they are freezable, the simplest way to freeze them pertaining to re-heating.
https://www.meibcafreezer.com/Cake-Display-Chiller-pl3737086.html
